text: Head to the "Dragonbone City" Styxia and continue your adventure

title: Mission Description
content: After dropping (Trailblazer) andPhainonoff at theGrove, Cipher rounded up the "Spirithief",Bartholos, and returned to the Nethershore for a bit of scavenging...

text: A millennium ago at Marmoreal Market...
Media:Trailblaze Mission Chest, Bear the Bygone Dust 1.mp4

speaker: Cipher
line: Seamstress, I've come as promised! Look at this box full of gold and silver treasures. I bet there's stuff here you've never seen!

speaker: Cipher
line: Come on, as we agreed, I want to buy the most valuable clothes you have!

speaker: Aglaea
line: Little thief, you've got some nerve, barging into my shop dressed in those tattered rags!

speaker: Aglaea
line: What have you brought? Let me see.

speaker: Cipher
line: Here, take a look! Only the finest goods — see this sapphire? It's even more blue than Phagousa 's eyes!

text: Media:Trailblaze Mission Chest, Bear the Bygone Dust 2.mp4

speaker: Aglaea
line: Ah...

speaker: Aglaea
line: Such exquisite luster... I've only seen an Ocean's Tear of this quality in my mother's treasury...

speaker: Cipher
line: ...Wait, you've seen one before? And here I thought I'd leave you speechless. Ugh, what a letdown.

speaker: Aglaea
line: It's just an old memory. My family estate all burned to ashes long ago. This workshop is what I built from scratch.

speaker: Cipher
line: Wow, a daughter rebuilding her family business — how admirable... Heh, enough with the jokes. At least you did get to enjoy those luxuries.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Heh... Mind your manners, kitty.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Tell me, Cifera, where did you come from, and how did you acquire these treasures?

speaker: Cipher
line: Ha, I won them fair and square in a bet. What, do you doubt me?

speaker: Cipher
line: Speak up, seamstress! Give me a straight answer. Do you want these or not?

speaker: Aglaea
line: Strange, you're clearly lying to my face...

speaker: Aglaea
line: But my golden thread... doesn't tremble at all.

speaker: Cipher
line: That's because I'm not lying. I've been telling the truth from the start.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Is that so? But the scars and mud stains on your face tell another story.

text: Media:Trailblaze Mission Chest, Bear the Bygone Dust 3.mp4

speaker: Cipher
line: ...Oh come on, can't we just do business without all this chatter? Don't worry, I didn't leave any evidence, so no one will bother you.

speaker: Aglaea
line: How can I trust a word you say when you're so skilled at lying?

speaker: Cipher
line: ...Dealing with you rich people is such a pain, always wasting my time! Fine, if you don't want it, there are plenty of others who do...

speaker: Aglaea
line: ...Hold on.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Your treasure — I'll accept it. But these alone aren't enough to purchase the Goldweaver's finest clothes.

speaker: Aglaea
line: That said, I do have something that would suit you perfectly.

speaker: Cipher
line: Oh? What do you have in mind?

text: Media:Trailblaze Mission Chest, Bear the Bygone Dust 4.mp4

speaker: Aglaea
line: Look. Come a bit closer.

speaker: Cipher
line: Oh! It's... shimmering gold, absolutely stunning!

speaker: Aglaea
line: These golden boots are one of the Goldweaver's greatest treasures. Though not as valuable as the most precious gowns, they hold a magical power.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Legend has it that Zagreus blessed these boots, allowing anyone who wears them to move swiftly and silently...

speaker: Aglaea
line: Put them on, Cifera, and don't get caught again. A face as lovely as yours deserves better protection.

speaker: Cipher
line: Hmph, you rich folks just love sticking your noses in everything, don't you? Well, I'm taking these now, so don't get any second thoughts!

speaker: Cipher
line: Uhh... hmm...

speaker: Aglaea
line: What's wrong?

speaker: Cipher
line: Uh... do you have a smaller size? These are way too big for me...

speaker: Aglaea
line: ...Well, I suppose you'll have to grow into them.

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: ...Fake! Fake!

speaker: Cipher
line: ...Do you have to interrupt me in the middle of my story? Fake? What's fake?

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Those boots definitely don't hold Zagreus's divine power!

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: You're Amphoreus 's most cunning liar, and even you were fooled by Aglaea — hehehe!

speaker: Cipher
line: Watch your mouth, or I'll feed you to the fish in the River of Souls !

speaker: Cipher
line: Weren't you curious how I got tangled up with that seamstress? Well, now you know. Satisfied?

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Hehe... I didn't expect such a simple story. How disappointing.

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: But, uh... Boss Lady, there's a chance Aglaea wasn't trying to trick you...

speaker: Cipher
line: Huh?

speaker: Cipher
line: ...You're defending her?

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Uh... no, no! I just think the story's so moving... it'd be a shame to ruin it with a lie. If I could cry, I'd be in tears right now!

speaker: Cipher
line: Ha! Good thing you've still got a sharp tongue, or you'd have been stuck guarding someone's front door ages ago.

speaker: Cipher
line: Enough chit-chat. Let's take a look at this place. The city of Styxia — look how beautiful she is!

speaker: Cipher
line: Let me take a good sniff of this air...

speaker: Cipher
line: Sniff... sniff...

speaker: Cipher
line: Prrrrrr~~

speaker: Cipher
line: This air... it's filled with the scent of treasure everywhere! Wonderful, just wonderful!

speaker: Cipher
line: Thanks to Castorice and Gray Mystery , the ancient city's barrier was finally dispelled. Now that I think about it, helping them was well worth it.

speaker: Cipher
line: Time for treasure hunting, Bartho! Lead the way, and whatever we find, we'll split 80-20.

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Uh, well, I have a suggestion... How about 70-30 instead?

speaker: Cipher
line: ...Listen closely. Do you hear that? The gnawfish in the River of Souls are growling with hunger...

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: ...80-20 it is! How generous you are, Boss Lady Cipher!

speaker: Cipher
line: Anyway... What's with all this water? It's damp, cold, and miserable here. I hate it...

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Hehe, the mighty demigod of Trickery... uneasy around water?

speaker: Cipher
line: You wouldn't understand! The people of Dolos are talented in many ways, just... not in swimming.

speaker: Cipher
line: Why don't we have a race? Long-distance, sprint, or laps — take your pick!

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Hehe, what's got you so worked up? Relax, relax... Who would've thought the fearless Lady Cipher was afraid of water!

speaker: Cipher
line: Cats hate getting wet. What's so hard to understand about that?

speaker: Cipher
line: Now hurry up and figure out a way across, or I might have to reconsider our split!

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Uh... don't rush me. Let me take a look around...

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Got it — let's use that thing! Come on! Follow me, Boss Lady!

speaker: Cipher
line: (Hmph... Not a good imitation.)

speaker: Cipher
line: (I'll play along... Let's see where this goes, "Bartholos." )

text: See what Bartholos is up to

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Tell me... how did you hunt for treasure when I wasn't around, Boss Lady?

speaker: Cipher
line: Hmph, trying to trick me into saying something? Not a chance.

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Hehe, you're as sharp as ever...

text: (Approach the marked location)

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Hehe, interesting, very interesting...

speaker: Cipher
line: Was this device designed by priests of Oronyx ? Do you think you can handle it?

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Don't underestimate me, Boss! Just find a cozy, dry corner and wait for me, hehe...

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Mission accomplished! Now you don't have to worry about your tail getting wet.

speaker: Cipher
line: Not bad. But just a warning — if this thing fails while we're halfway through the water...

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Don't worry. Trust me! For that sweet 20% cut of the loot, I'll make sure you're taken care of!

text: With the rune in hand, across the river we go

speaker: Cipher
line: Huh... this feels truly magical... When did you pick up this trick?

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Uh... self-taught, all self-taught!

text: Return the Rune to the base

speaker: Cipher
line: We're here! Can we turn off this spotlight now? It's really blinding.

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: No problem! Just use the device over there to shut it off.

text: Dig, dig — treasure awaits

speaker: Cipher
line: Sniff... sniff...

speaker: Cipher
line: The scent of gold coins, gems, and fine leather... it's so refreshing!

speaker: Cipher
line: The treasures in this ancient city are all floating back up thanks to Gray Mystery and that pink squirrel !

text: (Attempt to continue up toward theHand of Zagreus, before digging up the treasure)

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Slow down, Boss!

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Your legs are long and mine are short!

text: (Approach the marked location)

speaker: Cipher
line: Yes, right here —

speaker: Cipher
line: What are you waiting for? Start digging!

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Roger that! Watch me —

text: Bartholos activated excavation mode, unearthing the treasure buried deep underground...

speaker: Cipher
line: Wow... that's a huge chest! Move over. I want to open it myself!

speaker: Cipher
line: Wow, wow, a massive haul! Unbelievable, it's hard to imagine the kind of luxurious life the people of Styxia once led!

speaker: Cipher
line: As expected for a realm of Phagousa 's disciples. This entire chest is filled with ornaments made from Ocean's Tears... Here — take this, and see if it suits you.

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Hehe, thanks for the gift, Boss! Much appreciated!

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Look at the clarity of this purple crystal... It matches my skin tone perfectly! Cipher, Cipher, you truly have the most refined taste of all the thieves in Amphoreus!

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Hehe, let me try this on... Huh?

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Huh!? Where... where is... my treasure!?

speaker: Cipher
line: Hahahaha —

speaker: Cipher
line: How long have we known each other? I can't believe you still fall for this!

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Uh... this, this is...

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: ...Oh, how could I have forgotten about this?

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: "All believe it as true, and a lie becomes reality." What a convenient ability!

speaker: Cipher
line: The demigod of Trickery's divine gift, far more practical than any golden thread or teleporter!

speaker: Cipher
line: Alright, enough fooling around. Here's the real thing. Lead the way.

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Cipher rules! I've already pinpointed the next trove of treasure. Starting navigation... hehehe...

text: Keep hunting for the next trove!

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Boss Lady, we're set to make a fortune this time. Got any plans on how to spend it?

speaker: Cipher
line: Of course — spend nothing. Have you forgotten my silly prophecy?

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Ah... I remember, of course! Hehehe...

text: (Approach the Hand of Zagreus)

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Oh! Isn't that my...

speaker: Cipher
line: ...Uh-huh?

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: ...Ahem, isn't that a controller for the Hand of Zagreus?

speaker: Cipher
line: Ho, indeed it is.

text: (Check out the Hand of Zagreus, optional)

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Once activated, this thing makes a racket that can be heard for miles — just too stupid! What was—...

speaker: Cipher
line: Ahem... Seriously, what was the Titan thinking when they came up with this thing?

speaker: Cipher
line: Hey! If you don't want the "Trickery" to be exposed, you'd better start by keeping your mouth shut... What do you say?

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Uh... hehe, Boss Lady, you're absolutely right! I'll be careful with my words!

text: (Attempt to engage the Hand of Zagreus again, optional)

speaker: Cipher
line: This thing's way too loud when it's on... Let's not stir up more trouble, okay?

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Here we go round the River of Souls~

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Spirithief goes, Spirithief goes~

speaker: Cipher
line: ...What are you even singing? You're totally out of tune!

text: Knock out the monsters blocking the way
(Approach the marked location)

speaker: Cipher
line: Ho, there's a big guy guarding this place!

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Yeah, yeah... big and dumb, just a pure lump of stupidity!

text: (ApproachBlack Tide's Corroded Daemon)

speaker: Cipher
line: Look at its face — oh my, how could something be so ugly? Tsk tsk...

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Yeah, yeah, so ugly... ugly enough to make even me, a little imp without a digestive system, feel nauseous!

speaker: Cipher
line: If that ugly brute messes up my face, even the stoic Talanton might end up shedding a tear.

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Indeed, that would be heartbreaking! Clearly, running away is the sensible choice, hehe...

speaker: Cipher
line: So, how about you take the front? I'll attack from the side.

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Right, right. Fleeing fits our rogue nature...

text: (Enter battle againstBlack Tide's Corroded Daemon×1,Black Tide's Corroded Axe×1,Tide-Eroded Blade×1)
(After the battle)

speaker: Cipher
line: Ha! Such an ugly and useless creature, taken down with just a couple of hits. How boring!

speaker: Cipher
line: Hey, Bartholos, are you still alive? Give us a squeak if you are.

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: ...Here! I mean, squeak!

speaker: Cipher
line: Look at you, all shaken up. Can't handle even this bit of action?

speaker: Cipher
line: It should be safe here now. Get to work.

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Aye aye, Boss Lady Cipher!

text: Bartholos activated excavation mode, unearthing the treasure buried deep underground...

speaker: Cipher
line: Sniff... sniff...

speaker: Cipher
line: Hmm... It doesn't smell like anything valuable this time. Since we've already dug it up, let's open it and see.

speaker: Cipher
line: Hmm...? Is this...

text: The Journal of a Styxian Refugee
Month of Balance, Day ██

Three more neighboring households moved away today. The tide has risen higher than ever before, already reaching the fifth step of the stone stairway to our residence. The priests insist it's merely seasonal high tide that will soon recede, but having lived in Styxia for thirty years, I've never witnessed water levels like this.

Leandro from the harbor went fishing three days ago and reported that the seawater had become unusually turbid, appearing as if mixed with ink. Beneath the surface, he glimpsed strange shadows, not human in form yet possessing distinct outlines. After returning, he developed a high fever and has remained bedridden since.
Month of Balance, Day ██

The city's feasts have grown increasingly frenzied. Grand celebrations that once occurred only during the Month of Joy now happen almost daily. At the Anzo family's banquet last night, I witnessed two normally well-mannered women treading grapes barefoot, emitting strange laughter, and then directly drinking the dirt-laden juice. They claimed to be mimicking Phagousa's ritual ceremonies, though I've never heard of such an absurd form of worship.

Prices at the Market have risen by thirty percent. The honey brew merchant reports that the brewing process has become exceptionally difficult lately — the yeast cultures mysteriously rot. Only by distilling with seawater collected directly from the harbor can they produce proper wine.
Fortunately, our Doris remains lucid, and has wisely advised us to minimize our consumption of the city's water and wine.
Month of Everday, Day ██

Last night, strange music emanated from the harbor. It wasn't produced by any instrument, but seemed to rise from the ocean depths. The low, haunting melody sounded as if it were telling an ancient tale, compelling people to approach the shore. Several neighbors' children sleepwalked to the dock last night; they claimed to have seen "the goddess in the water" performing and wanted to get closer.

The priests have forbidden all forms of musical performance and deployed soldiers to patrol the docks. For some reason, I can't shake the feeling that they're acting from fear rather than a genuine desire to protect us.
Month of Everday, Day ██

Today I met Nora, the cloth merchant, at the market. She revealed that the situation in her district is far more dire than we had imagined. The spirit water pool in Phagousa's temple suddenly dried up three days ago, and despite their best efforts, the priests cannot replenish it. More alarming still, strange cracks have appeared on the wall behind the deity statue, forming patterns or script that no one can decipher.

Nora also shared a peculiar rumor: Some claim to have seen in their dreams a woman playing a lyre, draped in black veils, with eyes gleaming like seawater. She allegedly told dreamers that Styxia would soon face a great transformation, and only "those who hear her voice" would be saved. Some city residents have begun referring to her as the "prophetic sea musician" — despite the priests' determined efforts to suppress such rumors.
Month of Freedom, Day ██

We've finally decided to evacuate with our entire family. The seawater has reached the highest watermark at the dock, yet some remain oblivious, still immersed in endless revelry. Our family and the neighboring Milon household have decided to journey to Okhema together. Reportedly, the Worldbearing Titan 's protection extends there, and the tides of darkness has not yet invaded those lands. We plan to slip away quietly tonight from the northern dock exit. We pray to Phagousa for safe passage.
Month of Freedom, Day ██

We've been traveling for three days now. Last night, the Milon family's youngest child suddenly developed a high fever, continuously muttering strange phrases that resembled an ancient ballad. His father decided to take him back to the city for medical treatment, though we all know there is little hope to be found there.

This morning, looking back at Styxia from the hillside, I was horrified to discover the entire city enveloped in a strange aura, with seawater shimmering with an unnatural blue radiance in the sunlight. From a distance, those magnificent buildings seemed to twist and distort in the water, as if they were merely illusions.
Month of Weaving, Day ██

We encountered several other fleeing townspeople. They brought even more horrifying news: The seawater in Styxia has begun displaying strange colors and textures — sometimes thick as honey, other times solid as glass. Those who remained in the city have begun undergoing bizarre transformations, ███ ███████ ████ █████ ███.

Even more disturbing is that at night, the entire city bathes in an indescribable glow, as if enveloped by some gigantic amniotic membrane. They say this is Phagousa's punishment, but I can't help wondering: Is this the Titans' wrath, or is some power even greater than the Titans at work?

We've decided to continue northward to Okhema. Along the way, we've heard rumors of someone named ██████████ who can supposedly appease Phagousa's wrath, but these are merely legends fabricated by desperate people. We common folk can only rely on our own feet to flee this disaster.
Month of Weaving, Day ██

Tonight, after the children fell asleep, I secretly examined a small vial of seawater I brought from the city. It was the last drop collected from the spirit water pool in Phagousa's temple before we left. In the moonlight, it displays a strange shimmer, as if something moves within it, unlike any ordinary water.

By chance, I discovered that gently tapping the vial with my fingertip produces a peculiar sound, like distant lyre notes echoing. In that moment, I seemed to glimpse a mysterious woman standing upon the sea surface, sorrowfully playing a melody that no one could understand.

I don't know if this was illusion or reality. But if such a being truly exists, one who can hear the sorrows of Styxians, then as we embark on this uncertain journey, please grant us a flicker of hope — even if it's merely a beautiful dream.

Okhema is now within reach. Taking one final glance back at my homeland, the beautiful scenery of old is nowhere to be seen — only distorted masses of light and shadow undulating on the sea level, resembling foam heaped by waves before dawn, dissolving one by one to gradually reveal its cold and true nature...

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Oh... this looks tragic. Do you think they made it to Okhema?

speaker: Cipher
line: Probably not. I've never seen or heard of anyone from Styxia in Okhema.

speaker: Cipher
line: At least I'm still left for Dolos... Guess this city wasn't so lucky, huh?

speaker: Cipher
line: Heh, it does seem unfair, doesn't it? Just because they were born in the wrong place, they had to face such... devastation. Meanwhile, those in Okhema, simply because they're supported by the Worldbearing Titan, continue to survive...

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Yeah, the world just isn't fair, is it?

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Speaking of the Worldbearing Titan, Cipher, didn't you tell me once... you used to be an apprentice at Kephale's Priestly Court?

speaker: Cipher
line: ...Huh?

speaker: Cipher
line: Did I?

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Yes! You definitely told me, and I remember it clearly! Maybe it's been so long, your memory's gotten a little fuzzy, hehe...

speaker: Cipher
line: Hmph...

speaker: Cipher
line: ...Ah, right, I did tell you. It wasn't a big deal. I just snuck in with a bunch of mumbling priests and watched them do their spooky rituals around some glowing rock.

speaker: Cipher
line: Honestly, I was only interested in the wallets of the old grandpas on the Council back then. Don't remember much else — it's been, what, nearly a thousand years?

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Oh... I see. But you in a priest's robe? Now that's hard to picture.

speaker: Cipher
line: ...Who asked you to picture that? Besides, priest robes from a thousand years ago were nothing like the ones today.

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Right, right... I didn't think about that. I was just curious if you ever overheard anything interesting from those priests, hehe...

speaker: Cipher
line: Hmph. How ridiculous. Come on, let's head to the next spot!

text: Keep hunting for the next trove!
(Approach the marked location)

speaker: Cipher
line: Tsk, where did this roadblock come from?

speaker: Cipher
line: This is so annoying. The treasure is right in front of us...

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Oh dear, we're stuck here. But I have a plan —

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Should we call on that big, noisy, cumbersome Hand of Zagreus?

speaker: Cipher
line: Ha... never thought that thing would actually come in handy. Alright, do you want to handle it?

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Hehe... leave it to me, Boss!

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: I don't need a controller! After all... you know!

text: (Talk to Bartholos)

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Hand of Zagreus, my darling — activate!

text: Clear the obstacles using the Hand of Zagreus
(Disengaging the Hand of Zagreus, optional)

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: ...Eh? Why did it suddenly stop?

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: *cough* ...Just a tiny hiccup. No worries. Let's try again.

text: (After clearing the obstacles using the Hand of Zagreus)

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Hehe! Works like a charm!

speaker: Cipher
line: Ha, not bad! However, I still don't see how this ties into "Trickery."

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Let's go, to the next trove!

speaker: Cipher
line: Hey, slow down. That question you asked me earlier... I think I just remembered something.

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: ...Eh? What did I ask?

speaker: Cipher
line: You know... that question. The one you specifically asked me, right after we dug up the second chest.

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Uh... forgive me, Boss Lady, but have you been under a lot of stress lately? I didn't ask anything. You must've imagined it!

speaker: Cipher
line: Oh... is that so?

speaker: Cipher
line: Maybe you're right. I have been a little on edge lately. I need to relax... Alright, let's move on to the next treasure trove.

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Treasure! Let's go!

speaker: Cipher
line: (Hmph...)

text: More treasure awaits, keep searching!

speaker: Cipher
line: Twinkle, twinkle, in my chest~ How this Coreflame is the best!

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: When it comes to singing, I still sound better than you, Boss!

speaker: Cipher
line: ...Go beyond all time and space~ On the Journey of Flame-Chase~

text: (Approach the marked location)

speaker: Cipher
line: Sniff... sniff...

speaker: Cipher
line: Ooh, this scent... feels like something incredible is buried here.

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Incredible indeed! Hehe, if even Boss Lady says so, how can I not be excited?

speaker: Cipher
line: Do I need to give instructions here? Get digging!

text: Bartholos activated excavation mode, unearthing the treasure buried deep underground...

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: ...Heh?

speaker: Cipher
line: Oh, isn't this a Golden Scapegoat ? Interesting! Looks like whoever buried this treasure wanted to play a little game with us.

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Oh, isn't there a myth about this thing? "Those who feared fire became sheep, those who did not became human"...

speaker: Cipher
line: Sheep, humans — whatever. All I know is unlocking this gets us treasure. Here, this honor's all yours.

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Puzzles and tricks are right up my alley! Just leave it to little ol' me.

text: Solve the puzzle of the goat's head
(Interact with the Golden Scapegoat)
The treasure's here, grab it while you can!
(After trying to claim the reward from the Golden Scapegoat)

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Told you nothing can stump me, hehe!

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Cipher, it's your turn now...

speaker: Cipher
line: ...Stop, stay there, and don't turn around.

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Eh? What do you mean...

speaker: Cipher
line: I told you, don't move!

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: ...Ouch!

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Ow, my poor old back — what are you doing?

speaker: Cipher
line: ...Shh, quiet! Don't say anything unnecessary.

speaker: Cipher
line: That seamstress, she's listening.

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Wh—What!? Boss, do you mean...

speaker: Cipher
line: Stay put and keep quiet... I'll handle her.

speaker: Cipher
line: Well, well, seamstress! Getting sneaky, aren't we? Did you think I wouldn't notice your little spies lurking around me?

speaker: Golden Nymph
line: "As time passes... I find myself leaning more and more on blind luck."

speaker: Golden Nymph
line: "With only the power of this little nymph, naturally I couldn't slip past your sharp eyes... Cifera."

speaker: Cipher
line: Hmph... Even if you could fully control Bartholos's mind, I would still be able to see through your disguise — Aglaea.

speaker: Cipher
line: You've gone to such lengths to spy on my every move — what exactly are you after? I've told you before, you don't need me to succeed. Why won't you just let this go?

speaker: Cipher
line: I already made an exception and got involved with Castorice and Gray Mystery. Asking for more now... isn't that pushing your luck a bit too far?

speaker: Golden Nymph
line: "I... I'm sorry, Cifera."

speaker: Golden Nymph
line: "I've plotted and schemed my whole life, but I never could've predicted our relationship would end up like this."

speaker: Golden Nymph
line: "I've spent centuries trying to figure out where I went wrong, replaying every moment over and over. But you've never given me a chance to explain myself face-to-face."

speaker: Cipher
line: Don't... don't talk to me like that. You know I can't take it.

speaker: Golden Nymph
line: "A thousand years ago, out of foolishness... I let my silence steal away the most beautiful sound I'd ever known."

speaker: Cipher
line: Hysilens ...

speaker: Golden Nymph
line: "So this time, I must say this to you, even if it's all in vain — I need you, Cifera. The Chrysos Heirs' mission needs you."

speaker: Golden Nymph
line: "The finale I've delayed for far too long... it's finally here. Whatever resentment you still hold against me will fade once I'm gone."

speaker: Golden Nymph
line: "Please, come back to Okhema. I'm begging you. Without you, they don't stand a chance."

speaker: Cipher
line: ...I'll think about it, seamstress. But stop watching me... unless you want to lose me for good.

speaker: Golden Nymph
line: "Heh... Don't worry. As much as I'd love to hear your voice again, to see your face..."

speaker: Golden Nymph
line: "...it seems that chance will never come. Goodbye, Cifera."

speaker: Cipher
line: ...Goodbye, Aglaea.

text: (Transition to a new location)

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Ah, what a shame. I thought there'd be some real treasure under that goat's head.

speaker: Cipher
line: Turns out... everything in that chest was soaked in water from the River of Souls. Nothing valuable left.

speaker: Cipher
line: Those relics were once priceless. But time has eroded away all that they once were.

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Oh... hearing that from you makes it sound so sad.

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Wait, why am I getting all sentimental!? I haven't even processed what just happened — that horrible woman, when did she...

speaker: Aglaea
line: If you see her, let her know this: As demigods, we can't avoid our duties forever.

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Hmm... could it have been back then when...

speaker: Cipher
line: Do you remember now? Looks like you don't need me to jog your memory. She must've slipped that nymph into your "pocket" while you were distracted.

speaker: Cipher
line: Don't underestimate that bug. It's every bit as dangerous as the seamstress's golden thread. Let your guard down for even a second, and it might take over — make you spill secrets you'd never share otherwise.

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Whoa, that's like... some brainwashing monster straight out of the black tide . Creepy!

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Boss, how did you realize something was wrong? I'm curious — what exactly did that nymph make me say?

speaker: Cipher
line: Hmph, actually, it gave itself away very early on...

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Speaking of the Worldbearing Titan, Cipher, didn't you tell me once... you used to be an apprentice at Kephale's Priestly Court?

speaker: Cipher
line: We've been partners in crime for a thousand years. We've talked about everything there is to talk about. Except for that one experience at Dawncloud. I never told you about that.

speaker: Cipher
line: I... absolutely wouldn't have shared that with anyone.

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: But, uh... Boss Lady, there's a chance Aglaea wasn't trying to trick you...

speaker: Cipher
line: And as far as I know, the embodiment of "Trickery" despises that golden thread, which forces people to speak the truth. You'd never defend Aglaea...

speaker: Cipher
line: Isn't that right, Zagreus ?

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: You... have a terrifyingly sharp mind, hehe...

speaker: Cipher
line: After all, I'm the only one in the world who knows you're still alive. To make sure you survived the Titan trial, I had to fool the entire world.

speaker: Cipher
line: If you want to keep that lie from falling apart... you'd better keep playing your part in the days ahead.

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Even if it weren't for saving my worthless little life, I'd still walk through fire for Cipher without hesitation!

speaker: Cipher
line: Hmph, you may have been reduced to this form, but you still haven't lost your way with words.

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: *cough* ...Speaking of which, Cipher... you're not taking that wicked woman's words to heart, are you?

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Life's been pretty great lately. Why get into trouble now... Don't you think?

speaker: Cipher
line: Honestly, I've been thinking...

speaker: Cipher
line: Maybe a trip back now wouldn't be too bad.

speaker: Aglaea
line: ...You're back again, Cif—

text: Media:Trailblaze Mission Chest, Bear the Bygone Dust 5.mp4

speaker: Aglaea
line: Cifera, you...

speaker: Cipher
line: ...I need clothes.

speaker: Cipher
line: Anything, just throw me something. A piece of cloth will do, just enough to cover the wounds.

speaker: Cipher
line: I will pay back the amount I owe... I promise.

speaker: Aglaea
line: You... you're bleeding golden blood.

speaker: Cipher
line: ...Yes, what about it?

speaker: Cipher
line: So what if I'm one of those Chrysos Heirs they talk about? Those infinitely strong heroes? World-renowned swordsmen? Exceptionally intelligent scholars!?

speaker: Aglaea
line: Cifera...

speaker: Cipher
line: Well, I am sorry to disappoint! Who knew that group of amazing people would include me! A pauper, thief, con artist! Maybe I should just make another cut to drain all this yellow stuff out of me and-

speaker: Aglaea
line: ...Stop it, Cifera.

speaker: Aglaea
line: I'll give you clothes, warm you up, and...

speaker: Aglaea
line: Stay here. Stay in my workshop until you're healed.

speaker: Cipher
line: ...Tch.

speaker: Cipher
line: Aren't you going to ask me how I got these wounds?

speaker: Cipher
line: Heh, right, what's the use? I'm so good at lying, even your golden thread can be fooled. If you can't verify the truth, why bother asking at all?

speaker: Aglaea
line: ...I don't need to ask, nor do I need to use the golden thread. I know everything you do is for survival, at all costs.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Stay here. You won't have to deal with the cold or go hungry again. Stay by my side, and you can start putting yourself back together.

text: Media:Trailblaze Mission Chest, Bear the Bygone Dust 6.mp4

speaker: Cipher
line: Aren't you... worried I'll ruin this place's reputation? Or that I might sneak off with your precious clothes and sell them?

speaker: Aglaea
line: I wouldn't have invited you if I were worried about those things.

speaker: Cipher
line: You're weird, seamstress. You know, they say a child who often lies remains a liar for life...

speaker: Cipher
line: I've tried not to become a liar. But... honestly? It's just too hard... I'm close to giving up.

speaker: Cipher
line: What makes you think I won't disappoint you?

speaker: Aglaea
line: Because I can feel it — not with the power of a demigod, but with the heart that beats in my chest — you love this place.

speaker: Aglaea
line: That's why you keep coming by but also why you hesitate to stay longer. You worry you'll tarnish the "Goldweaver" name.

speaker: Aglaea
line: After taking over Mnestia's divine authority, I became used to letting the golden thread distinguish sincerity from falsehood. However, the mission I need to complete requires me to learn to trust and rely on my heart.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Cifera — you're an honest thing I've given to this world... and also a challenge the world has given to me.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Stay here with me. You have a beautiful face that deserves better than to be covered in scars and grime.

speaker: Cipher
line: You've got a way of talking that's hard to follow.

speaker: Cipher
line: Alright, let's make it a deal. You have one day to change your mind — once the Action Hour passes, there's no turning back.

text: When you have a chance to make a choice, make one that you know you won't regret.
